qas.question: How many schools does Washington University have?
What percent of undergraduate students are involved in faculty research?
How does the Center for Measuring University performance rank Washington University?

answers.text: one of the top 10 private research universities in the nation

qas.question: Where is the Office of Undergraduate Research located?
What percentage of faculty members at Washington University engage in academic research?
Where is the Center for Measuring University Performance located?
What is considered the top 10 private research university in the nation?
What university is known for interdisciplinarity and departmental noncooperation?

context: Virtually all faculty members at <b6_0><b7_0>Washington University<b7_0/><b6_0/> engage in academic research,[citation needed] offering opportunities for both undergraduate and graduate students across the university's <a0_0>seven<a0_0/> schools. Known for its interdisciplinarity and departmental collaboration, many of Washington University's research centers and institutes are collaborative efforts between many areas on campus.[citation needed] More than <a1_0><b4_0>60%<b4_0/><a1_0/> of undergraduates are involved in faculty research across all areas; it is an institutional priority for undergraduates to be allowed to participate in advanced research. According to the Center for Measuring University Performance, it is considered to be <a2_0>one of the top 10 private research universities in the nation<a2_0/>. A dedicated Office of Undergraduate Research is located on <a3_0><b5_0>the Danforth Campus<b5_0/><a3_0/> and serves as a resource to post research opportunities, advise students in finding appropriate positions matching their interests, publish undergraduate research journals, and award research grants to make it financially possible to perform research.
